column4: Hey guys, can anyone tell me why xubuntu is super slow on an older computer, but is really fast in a VMware with the same specs?
if you have an older computer don't use compositing on xfce. It defeats the purpose of xfce on a slower computer. ( ,_,)
can i install drivers manually? if so, how?
what version of xubuntu are you using?
i installed Xubuntu as it seemed to use the least ram and still be very functional
what distro would you recommend for a computer with 256mbs of ram and 1.2ghz cpu? (im trying to make something like a fileserver with this old PC, but need gui)
Ubuntu, even xubuntu, is not good for old things unless you install ubuntu-server than then put a bare minimum gui on top of that.
I'd suggest ubuntu-server and aptitude install blackbox
what is blackbox? like a lightweight gui?
very very lightweight gui. It's too lightweight for most people to tolerate. That or tdm are going to be your best friends if you absolutely need some sort of GUI......
out of curiosity, what is the GUI needed for?
i will need it to set up what I need.. I don't know how to do everything in terminal

Weeeelllllll what things are you doing setup in the GUI, and maybe I can point you in the right direction of where to learn? =) Blackbox+vnc server are going to be great fallbacks if you need the gui, but SSH is faster and runs a lot lighter. :3
Not plugging the OMG GUI ON A SERVER thing, I don't judge, I'm just saying that help is aailable. =P
oh, i would probably uninstall gui once im done configuring what i need
i tried dsl and it wouldn't run latest firefox...
